title: The truth about Labradoodles and other designer dogs? They’re no madder than pure breeds
text:
As the creator of the labradoodle says the crossbreed is his 'life's regret', Peter Stanford bounds to the defence of designer dogs

When Wally Conron bred the world’s first Labradoodle back in 1989, there was a practical reason for doing it.

A client was looking for a guide dog with fur, not hair, so it wouldn’t inflame her husband’s allergies. In hitting upon the idea of crossing a Labrador with a Poodle to successfully solve her problem, 89-year-old Australian Conron now believes he has created a monster.

It is, he says, his “life’s regret”, because too many of the legion of Labradoodle crossbreeds that have subsequently become so popular as pets are either “crazy” or plagued by health problems....
